function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Close proximity of urban homes and population density may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased risk of rapid transmission and propagation of contagious diseases within urban areas.","Mitigation":"Implementing measures to reduce population density, social distancing protocols, and increasing access to healthcare facilities.","Technologies":"Digital health tracking systems, remote healthcare consultations, and telemedicine.","People":"Urban population, families residing in urban homes.","Owner":"Local governments, urban planning authorities, healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of access to public services such as sanitation and clean water may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Higher incidence of water-borne and sanitation-related diseases, leading to increased health risks within the population.","Mitigation":"Improving access to clean water, sanitation facilities, and implementing public health education programs.","Technologies":"Water purification systems, smart sanitation solutions, and public health awareness apps.","People":"Communities with inadequate access to clean water and sanitation.","Owner":"Public health departments, local government, NGOs."},{"Description":"Lack of health insurance coverage and limited access to healthcare facilities may result in undetected and uncontrolled contagious diseases within the population.","Impact":"Delayed diagnosis and treatment of contagious diseases, leading to increased community transmission and public health risks.","Mitigation":"Expanding health insurance coverage, increasing the number of healthcare facilities, and promoting preventive healthcare measures.","Technologies":"Telehealth platforms, medical diagnostic devices, and community health monitoring systems.","People":"Uninsured individuals, communities with limited healthcare facilities.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, insurance providers, government health agencies."}]}
